triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: The paper extends pairwise games to higher-order networks, building on game-theoretic foundations for analyzing strategic interactions.

triples.name: Social dilemma
triples.relevance: The paper studies social dilemmas on hypergraphs to understand how cooperation emerges from competitive interactions.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: The paper uses hypergraphs as the core mathematical structure for modeling higher-order interactions beyond pairwise networks.

triples.name: Cooperation (evolution)
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the fundamental biological and social science problem of how cooperative behavior emerges in competitive systems.

triples.name: Complex network
triples.relevance: The paper extends network theory beyond simple pairwise interactions to study complex topological structures.

triples.name: Bistability
triples.relevance: The paper discovers a bistable regime where cooperation exhibits two stable states, requiring a critical mass of cooperators to emerge.
